result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lachon S Dixon

records.addlTxt:
9:18 AM Defendant Lachon S Dixon in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case was set for 8:30 AM. Defendant was here on time. Defendant states Atty Kovac was retained privately. Clerk has tried to unsuccessfully contact Atty Kovac via phone and email. Defendant also attempted to contact Atty Kovac. 

Court reschedules case based upon Attorney Kovac's non-appearance. 

Court will toll running of time limits for arraignment.  

Atty Kovac later appeared off the record. 11/14/2022 hearing remains as set.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:04 PM Defendant Lachon S Dixon in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Lachon S Dixon.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kovac requests to have the arraignment in front of the Trial Court.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn the arraignment in front of the Trial Court.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:47 AM Defendant Lachon S Dixon in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Lachon S Dixon.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. City of Brookfield Police Department Officer Jason Krueger sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Campbell. Cross examination by Attorney Kovac. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Kovac objects to bind over with argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. Attorney Kovac is asking for an arraignment date back before the Commissioner. The Court will set this matter back before the Commissioner for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lachon S Dixon
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 10224 W. North Avenue, Wauwatosa, WI 53226

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

1:59 PM Defendant Lachon S Dixon in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Lachon S Dixon. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
